ai.question: Using a systematic troubleshooting approach, a help desk technician suspects a problem at layer 3 of the OSI model. Which two questions could be asked to isolate the problem to layer 3? (Choose two.)

choice.text: Is your PC configured for DHCP?
Can you browse to www.cisco.com?
Is your network cable plugged in?
Can you ping your default gateway?
Do you see a link light on your network card?

ai.question: A customer call has been escalated to an on-site technician because the level 1 and 2 technicians could not determine the problem. Which three tasks would be performed by the on-site technician? (Choose three.)

choice.text: open the trouble ticket and enter customer information
replace faulty cables or connections
check to see if the ISP email server is working
correct PC network settings and run any necessary utilities
swap out suspected faulty hardware with known good hardware
check the customer account payment status

ai.question: Which two actions should be taken after a customer problem is resolved by the ISP help desk? (Choose two.)

choice.text: delete the trouble ticket from the database
document the solution in the trouble ticket or work order
escalate the trouble ticket to Level 2 for future reference
file a work order for customer notification
copy the solution into a knowledge-base document for future reference

ai.question: Which two scenarios are common causes of physical network connectivity problems? (Choose two.)

choice.text: monitor unplugged
Ethernet cable plugged into wrong port
incorrect default gateway
unassigned IP address
faulty Ethernet cable

ai.question: What two tasks should an on-site technician perform before beginning any troubleshooting or repair at the customer site? (Choose two.)

choice.text: review the trouble ticket with the customer to verify the information is correct
take damaged equipment to the ISP site for repair
document the troubleshooting tasks performed and the solution
provide identification, including name and place of employment
examine cabling to determine if it is faulty or connected into the wrong port

ai.question: An ISP customer calls to report that the web server web-s1.cisco.com is not reachable through a web browser. The technician uses command line utilities to verify the problem and to begin the troubleshooting process. Based on the results shown in the graphic, what two things can be determined about the problem? (Choose two.)

choice.text: The web server at 192.168.0.10 is reachable from the source host.
There is a problem with the web server software on web-s1.cisco.com.
A router is down between the source host and the server web-s1.cisco.com.
DNS cannot resolve the IP address for the server web-s1.cisco.com.
The default gateway between the source host and the server at 192.168.0.10 is down.

ai.question: What does a successful ping response from the 127.0.0.1 loopback address on a host indicate?

choice.text: The default gateway is configured correctly.
The TCP/IP stack loaded correctly.
The DNS server address is correctly configured.
The DHCP configuration loaded correctly.

ai.question: Which range of addresses is referred to as link-local addresses?
